titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I took Beeching for a walk through the wood. In spite of the clouded sky, & humid atmosphere, the views were impressive. Bayley came to lunch. I wrote to Carissima, & then attended Evensong in the Cathedral. Then I summoned my resolution, & had my hair cut by the local barber! We gave a dinner–party. There were present, in addition to ourselves and our guests, the following – Bp. & M
Gee, Col: Grimshaw, & Major Iremonger, Miss Christopher, M
Cavendish. After dinner two more officers came in & some others.
